intro: Sideroxylon pomiferum, commonly known as the apple tree of Madagascar, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grayish bark and glossy, dark green leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are followed by edible, apple-like fruits. These fruits are an important food source for both wildlife and local communities in Madagascar.
